intro: Palicourea racemosa, commonly known as the blue cohosh, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically ovate with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Palicourea racemosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
